channel.title: BBC News - Business

item.title: Fraud warning for young: 'I had £700 stolen'
item.description: An anti-fraud charity says banks are not doing enough to warn young adults about the dangers of fraud.

item.title: Delays in state pension payments 'causing anxiety'
item.description: Hundreds of new state pension claimants failed to get payments due to Covid and staffing problems.

item.title: Driver shortage: 50,000 more HGV driving tests promised a year
item.description: The government will make it quicker to get an HGV driver licence, amid an industry-wide shortage.

item.title: What is 'individual transport' and why is it important?
item.description: At the first major car sector event since Covid environmentally-friendly mobility was the hot topic.

item.title: Food shortages could be permanent, warns industry body
item.description: Shoppers are unlikely to have a wide range of products to choose from, due to supply chain issues.

item.title: Apple dealt major blow in Epic Games trial
item.description: A judge in the Apple vs Epic trial says Apple must give app developers alternative payment options.

item.title: Watchdog urges tougher line on Covid test firms
item.description: Basic standards for firms to qualify for the government list should be significantly improved, says the CMA.

item.title: Emma Raducanu set to be best-paid British sportswoman
item.description: The teenage tennis star's potential earnings skyrocket as she reaches the US Open final.

item.title: 'Pingdemic' dents UK economic growth in July
item.description: The UK economy grew just 0.1% in July, with Covid self-isolation keeping many workers at home.

item.title: Rail industry urges workers not to spurn the train
item.description: City centres and High Streets could suffer unless workers start taking the train again, the industry warns.

item.title: Covid: Biden orders employees of big businesses to be vaccinated or face testing
item.description: The US president is using his executive power to require that big companies vaccinate employees.

item.title: First UK LGBT business champion appointed
item.description: Iain Anderson says he will work to "build a bridge" between the government and LGBT community.

item.title: Boden boss declares the end of formal office wear
item.description: As the British brand celebrates 30th anniversary, its founder reflects on how fashion tastes have changed.

item.title: How a monkey launched the pop-it toy craze
item.description: Why it took a TikTok primate to turn a forty-year-old idea into a global hit

item.title: The models that turned Instagram into their DIY catwalk
item.description: New York Fashion Week marks a tentative return - but how did supermodels keep working through Covid?

item.title: CEO Secrets: The bra boss busting stereotypes
item.description: Leanne Cahill, CEO of Bravissimo, shares her journey from shop floor to boardroom in retail.

item.title: Why coders love the AI that could put them out of a job
item.description: Artificial intelligence is getting better at penning code but still a long way from working alone.

item.title: Has Covid killed off business cards for good?
item.description: Sales of business cards have fallen sharply as a result of the pandemic.

item.title: 'Bitcoin fraud cost me £500,000'
item.description: A successful businessman saw his life savings wiped out when he fell victim to ruthless fraudsters.
